title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 §§ 4-9.3 - Pilot or torch to be proven
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 §§ 4-9.3 - Pilot or torch to be proven

State Regulations

On manually lighted or automatically ignited gas-fired
boilers, the pilot or torch shall be proven at a location where it will
reliably ignite the main burner before permitting the main burner gas valve to
open either automatically or manually by completing an electrical
circuit. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12
§§
4-9.3

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
